summary: Beth Anne Lichtenfels was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). She is listed in payroll certifications and certification reports for the SCA during the period of April 1978 to December 1978. These documents detail her employment, salary, and pay during that time. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Beth Anne Lichtenfels' significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation into the JFK assassination, albeit in an unspecified role.
